page.title: 12COLLEGE OF AGRICULTURE
page.content: The West Sussex College of Agriculture and Horticulture provides courses for some 460 students. It is on Brinsbury estate of 526 acres and mainly on the western side of the A29. Full time tuition is given for the National Certificate in Agriculture; and part time day release courses for the City and Guilds examinations. The farm at Brinsbury provides a range of commercial enterprises typical of a Weald farm. Lecture blocks and workshops for carpentry, metalwork,and agricultural machinery are manned by a staff of 30. The dairy herd has 100 Friesian cows, mostly pedigree. A flock of 300 ewes of Clun Forest and Welsh Mule breed produce some 420 lambs each year. A pig herd of 120 sows, 6 boars and their progeny is housed at Todhurst Farm on the east side of the A29.
